parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Jewish. From Iouda; Judaean, i.e. Belonging to Jehudah.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Mid. and pass: To make a compact (agreement) with (together), covenant with, agree.
Apparently from ereo; to interrogate; by implication, to request.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From hos and pos; what(-ever) how, i.e. In the manner that (as adverb or conjunction of coincidence, intentional or actual).

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From kata and ago; to lead down; specially, to moor a vessel.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.
Tomorrow. From a derivative of the same as aer; properly, fresh, i.e. to-morrow.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To ask, inquire, ascertain by inquiry, understand.
Carefully, exactly, strictly, distinctly. Adverb from the same as akribestatos; exactly.
From the base of peran; properly, through, i.e. Around; figuratively with respect to; used in various applications, of place, cause or time.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
